comments:
I have a copy of Eclipse which I use with two different workspaces via two
different startup shortcuts (in Windows).

I was running Eclipse with one workspace, and performed an update from 2.0.1,
inlcuding the SDK and a few other items like the FTP/WebDAV lib, basically
everything that was available. No issues.

I then proceeded to try to start Eclipse in the second workspace (while still
having the first open), and got an exception and refusal to start:
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Nov 14, 2002 17:50:20.766
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: prefixTable
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginClassLoader.<init>(PluginClassLoader.java:45)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.getPluginClassLoader(PluginDescriptor.java:315)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.createXMLClassLoader(InternalPlatform.java:256)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderStartup(InternalPlatform.java:561)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:909)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:768)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

Retrying resulted in the same exception. Shutting down the first instance and
starting the second again reulted in the same exception.

Kill all the metadata for the second instance and restarting it, resulted in a
clean start.

I would attach the metadata for the second workspace, but don't find an area to
do it. I will try to do so after the bug is filed, maybe it only lets you do it
then.

I wanted to create an attachment with the metadata, but it is 1.3 MB in size and
won't let me attach  it. Please provide an email to mail it to if the metadata
would be useful.
*** Bug 26891 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Action Taken: this issue occurs when upgrading 2.0.1 to 2.0.2 in the same directory
Action Plan: change subject

Action Taken:
The wrong boot.jat was picked up. We picked up boot.jar 2.0.1 instead of the new
one: 2.0.2. Because of boot.xml having a match equivalent on runtime 2.0.1, we
picked up runtime 2.0.2 instead which is incompatible (bitecodewise) with
boot.jar 2.0.1
Solution:
Platform.cfg will compute hash code of all org.eclipse.core.boot plugin path and
save it in platform.cfg. Upon startup, Main will also compute the same hashcode
and compare it with platform.cfg. If the hash has changed,or it didn't exist,
Main will find the best boot.jar as if platform.cfg didn't exist.
Action taken: implement
*** Bug 28014 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have also found these exact same symptoms, but with a twist.  I am running
Gentoo linux, which supports Eclipse 2.0.2 in binary form.  I installed the
following packages:

dev-util/eclipse-platform-bin-2.0.2 
dev-util/eclipse-jdt-bin-2.0.2 
dev-util/eclipse-ftp-webdav-bin-2.0 
dev-util/eclipse-cdt-bin-20020704 
dev-util/eclipse-SDK-20021016 

And I got the error.  But, if I remove the packages, and just install the
eclipse-platform-bin-2.0.2 one first, and run eclipse with just that, then I
don't get the error.  After running it once, I can install the other packages
and it works fine.

Hope that helps.

Do you get the exact same log, or just the exact same sympton (i.e. it doesn't
start) ?

Do you get the exact same log, or just the exact same sympton (i.e. it doesn't

Added Zed in CC list. Zed please check my previous message

I am running eclipse on Redhat 7.3, and just got the same behavior described
above, after upgrading from 2.0 to 2.0.2 (using the upgrade functionality from
within eclipse).  However, I didn't have any other instances of eclipse running.

Deleting the .metadata directory fixed the problem

Here's the .log file:

The issue is with the update, not the different eclipse running. You were
upgrading in the same directory.
Do we know what the problem is?
I can see it now - sorry.
Unless becoming a blocker, defer to 2.2
